summary:
• Outlines procedures for when a clerk receives an absent voter ballot application missing a signature, including timeline and notification requirements.
  • Specifies when the clerk may reject the absent voter ballot application with no signature.
  • Specifies procedures if the board of election inspectors determines signatures do not match on an absentee ballot envelope.
  • Specifies procedures for the clerk if he or she rejects an absent voter ballot application because signatures do not match.
  • Provides language for a signature verification statement, the unsigned ballot statement, instructions for the absent voter ballot.
  • Makes clarifying edits.
  • Makes conforming changes.

name: Elections: special elections; state to reimburse costs for certain special elections; require.
summary:
• Requires the state to reimburse a municipality for the cost of conducting a special election for a vacancy for state senator or representative, with certain requirements.
  • Outlines repayment procedures, source of funding, qualification requirements, and notification requirements if the request is not approved.

name: Elections: offenses; false statements or misrepresentations concerning elections; prohibit.
summary:
• Outlines misdemeanor penalties for making false statements related to elections.
  • Provides that anyone employing someone for election-related purposes, who committed one of the mentioned crimes, is subject to a civil fine.

name: Elections: voting procedures; early voting; provide for.
summary:
• Requires polls to be open 7am-8pm on Election Day.
  • Stipulates that polls should be open for at least eight hours during early voting, and includes the timeframe for poll openings.
  • Requires a public notification about days, times, and locations polls are open for early voting.  
  • Directs each jurisdiction to provide at least one early voting polling place and outlines how the clerk may achieve this.
  • Directs the Secretary of State to cooperate with each jurisdiction in providing technical assistance for early voting.
  • Establishes that early voting polling places are subject to the same requirements as Election Day polling places.
  • Requires that the poll book be maintained and ballots be processed and tabulated the same way as they would be on Election Day.
  • Requires that the poll book be divided by date, with separate records maintained for each day during the early voting period.

name: Elections: absent voters; absent voter counting boards; modify, and revise number of challengers allowed under certain circumstances. Amends secs. 730 & 764d of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.730 & 168.764d).
most_recent_action: Referred To Committee On Elections And Ethics
summary:
• Applies existing rules related to the counting board to the absent voter counting board.
  • Establishes that a challenger may be designated to serve at an absent voter counting board.
  • Allows a specific increased number of challengers if a counting board has more than 2,999 absent voter ballots to count.
  • Allows one challenger for every three election inspectors at an absent voter counting board.
  • Allows a challenger to be replaced if an absent voter counting board continues to work after polls close on Election Day.

name: Elections: election officials; county clerks to update the qualified voter file to cancel the voter registration records of deceased voters; require, require electronic notification to city and township clerks of canceled voter registration records, and require the secretary of state to post data on the department's website regarding canceled voter registration records.
summary:
• Adds counties to the list of jurisdictions the Secretary of State must provide information to about a canceled voter registration.
  • Requires the clerk to monthly update the qualified voter file with deaths.
  • Outlines what the clerk should do when receiving information from the Secretary of State about canceled voter registrations, and what the Secretary should do related to electronic notifications.
  • Outlines what a clerk should do in the 16-45 days before the election related to updating qualified voter files.
  • Outlines what the clerk should do in the 1-15 days before the election to update the qualified voter files.
  • Requires the Secretary of State to monthly post the number of voter registrations canceled, including specific information.

name: Elections: election officials; procedure to remove certain electors listed on the qualified voter file who have not recently voted; provide for. Amends sec. 509bb of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.509bb).
summary:
• Prohibits a clerk from canceling a voter registration based solely on a voter not voting.
  • Establishes guidelines and procedures for clerks to confirm a voter should stay on the active voter list if they have not voted since November 2000.
  • Outlines what to do if a related notification sent to a voter comes back as undeliverable.

name: Elections: election officials; procedure to remove certain electors listed on the qualified voter file with unknown dates of birth; provide for. Amends sec. 510 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.510).
summary:
• Requires the county clerk to monthly send a list of all deceased residents to the clerk or each city or township in the county, and requires authorities to cancel the registration of those deceased individuals who were registered to vote.
  • Outlines procedures and timelines for verifying qualified voters who were assigned a placeholder date of birth because their date of birth was unknown.

name: Elections: absent voters; sending unsolicited absent voter ballot applications; prohibit. Amends sec. 759 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.759).
summary:
• Provides that an absent voter may apply for an application through email and fax, along with mail and in-person.
  • Prohibits absent voter ballot applications to be sent out until 75 days before an election.
  • Requires that a voter request an application for an absent ballot before one is sent to him or her, unless the voter is on the permanent absent voter list.
  • Prohibits the Secretary of State from sending absent voter applications to any voter.

name: Elections: election officials; election inspectors filing an affidavit indicating political party affiliation; require. Amends sec. 677 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.677).
summary:
• Requires applicants for precinct election inspector to sign an attestation stating that the information in their application is true, with penalties for perjury if the information is not true.
  • Requires the clerk to maintain a file of applications.
  • Requires the clerk to give each chairperson of a precinct, and each political party chairperson, a list of precinct election inspectors with a certification that the people on the list have a complete application file, including listing party affiliation.
  • Directs that the list of precinct election inspectors be made available to the public.

name: Elections: challengers; election challengers designated to a city or township clerk’s office or satellite office on election day; authorize. Amends secs. 730, 731 & 733 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.730 et seq.).
summary:
• Allows organizations to designate additional challengers to an absent voter counting board precinct.
  • Establishes rules for if the counting cannot be properly viewed, limits on the number of challengers, space guidelines, and where the challengers may be.
  • Requires a challenger to be a Michigan registered voter, and not a candidate in the jurisdiction where he or she is serving. 
  • Clarifies other requirements and rules for challengers.
  • Outlines requirements for the statement by an organization appointing challengers, including making several previously optional aspects mandatory for the organization and the clerk.
  • Requires clerks to provide a designated area where challengers may observe voters signing in and voting.
  • Outlines requirements for the designated area and authorized locations for challengers.
  • Lists appropriate actions for challengers.
  • Requires all challenges made to be recorded and delivered to tabulating locations.
  • Adds possible locations for election activities to include a city or township clerk's office, or any satellite office.

name: Elections: offenses; accepting a gift of money or goods from a nongovernmental entity for the purposes of obtaining election-related equipment; prohibit. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 946.
summary:
• Prohibits governmental agencies from accepting private gifts for election related purposes.
  • Makes certain exceptions related to locales for voting related work.
  • Defines terms.

name: Elections: absent voters; use of a digital or electronic signature to sign an absent voter ballot application; prohibit. Amends sec. 759 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.759).
summary:
• Expands methods to apply for an absent voter ballot.

  • Prohibits absent voter ballot applications to be made available more than 75 days before an election.

  • Requires a voter to physically sign an absent voter ballot application and not use a digital signature.

name: Elections: election officials; list of local clerks who are not current with continuing election education training; require secretary of state to post on department of state website. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 33a.
most_recent_action: Referred to Committee of the Whole
summary:
• Requires the Secretary of State to post the name of each jurisdiction's clerk that is not current in his or her continuing election education training on the department of state website by July 1 in odd numbered years. 
  • Requires the Secretary of State to remove the name when provided with the required proof that the training was completed.
  • Requires the Secretary of State to send notice to clerks who are not current in their continuing election education training by June 1 in odd numbered years, and to not put their names on the website if they complete training by July 1.

name: Elections: ballot proposals; secretary of state to post on the department’s website a summary of and the date a ballot petition is received; require. Amends sec. 475 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.475).
summary:
• Requires the Secretary of State to immediately notify the board of state canvassers about the filing of a petition, specifying timelines and methods of notification.
  • Requires the Secretary of State to post public information on the department's website about the filing of the petition, with specific timelines and instructions.
  • Prohibits the Secretary of State from accepting further filings regarding the same petition after the petition has been filed.

name: Elections: election officials; secretary of state to prepare a report regarding clerks who are not current with training; require, and require secretary of state to post the report on the department of state website. Amends 1954 Pa 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 33a.
most_recent_action: House Elections and Ethics (12:00 3/1/2022 Room 326, House Office Building)
summary:
• Requires the Secretary of State, within 60 days before a November general election, to prepare a report to the legislature for each municipality outlining the completion of training and requires the report be posted on the Department of State website.
  • Requires the Secretary of State to sent a notice to each municipality not current on its training within 90 days of the November general election, and outlines reporting procedures based on the response from the municipality.

name: Elections: election officials; signature verification training for clerks and election inspectors; require, and require the secretary of state to promulgate rules regarding an objective signature verification process. Amends sec. 31 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.31).
most_recent_action: House Elections and Ethics (12:00 3/1/2022 Room 326, House Office Building)
summary:
• Requires the Secretary of State to create and require signature verification training for clerks.
  • Outlines requirements for developing the signature verification training.
  • Lists items the training must not include.

name: Elections: canvassing; requirement for a county board of canvassers to meet in January of each even numbered year; modify.
summary:
• Requires the board of county canvassers to elect a chair and vice-chair at their first meeting (rather than in the month of January).
  • Provides clarifying language.

name: Elections: qualified voter file; most recent digitized signature of an elector from a state personal identification card application to be contained in the qualified voter file; require. Amends secs. 509q, 509gg & 509hh of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.509q et seq.).
summary:
• Makes conforming changes regarding drivers license and personal identification card rules.
  • Changes the word voter to elector throughout.

name: State: identification cards; renewal of state identification cards; limit to 8 years, and require secretary of state to update photo and signature files for use in the qualified voter file. Amends secs. 1 & 2 of 1972 PA 222 (MCL 28.291 & 28.292).
categories: Voter ID for registration,Signature matching,Voter list maintenance
summary:
• Requires the Secretary of State to capture an applicant's signature when an applicant is renewing a driver's license or identity card and upload it to the qualified voter file.
  • Clarifies the definition of "veteran."

name: Traffic control: driver license; renewal of driver license; limit to 8 years, and require secretary of state to update photo and signature files for use in the qualified voter file. Amends sec. 307 of 1949 PA 300 (MCL 257.307).
categories: Voter ID for registration,Signature matching,Voter list maintenance
summary: • Allows an applicants signature on an operator's or chauffeur's license renewal to be uploaded to their qualified voter file.

name: Criminal procedure: sentencing guidelines; sentencing guidelines for certain Michigan election law violations dealing with absent voter ballot applications; provide for. Amends sec. 11d, ch. XVII of 1927 PA 175 (MCL 777.11d). TIE BAR WITH: HB 4132'21
most_recent_action: Referred to Committee of the Whole
summary:
• Removes "forged signature on absentee ballot" from the list of criminal election offenses.
  • Adds to the list knowingly submitting an absent voter application with false information or a forged signature.

name: Elections: offenses; certain felonies involving absent voter ballot applications; create. Amends sec. 759 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.759).
most_recent_action: Referred to Committee of the Whole
summary:
• Codifies that a person submitting an absent voter ballot application with false information or forged signature is committing a felony.
  • Codifies that a person submitting another voter's absent ballot application without consent is guilty of a felony.
  • Codifies that a person who submits an absent voter application with the intent to obtain multiple ballots for a person is guilty of a felony.
  • Makes conforming changes.

name: Elections: political parties; state political party to change name to affiliated national political party; allow. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 685a.
most_recent_action: House Government, Elections and Indian Affairs Committee (13:00:00 13:00:00 Room 305)
summary:
• Authorizes a qualified political party to change its name by 110 days before a general November election.
  • Requires certain party leadership to file a certification with the Secretary of State.

name: Courts: judges; personal information and physical safety protections for judges, their families, and household members; enhance. Creates new act.
most_recent_action: Referred to Committee on Judiciary and Public Safety
summary:
• Allows a judge to submit a written form to prevent disclosure of their personal information, or their family's personal information, and outlines what must be on the form.
  • Prohibits those receiving the request from publishing it, making it public, or selling it, or if it was already made public, requires the information be removed within five business days. 
  • Creates an exception allowing the judge and his or her family to choose to make their information public.
  • Exempts from disclosure personal information covered in the written request form.
  • Allows a judge to provide a PO Box instead of a residential address in public documents.
  • Establishes that a judge may start a civil action to compel compliance with this act and outlines the procedure and punishments.
  • Calls this act the "Judicial Protection Act."
  • Defines relevant terms.

name: Counties: boards and commissions; removal of local health officer; provide for. Amends sec. 11 of 1851 PA 156 (MCL 46.11). TIE BAR WITH: HB 5355'21
summary:
• Allows county board of commissioners to remove the appointed local health officer for any reason by a majority vote.

  • Defines local health officer.

name: Elections: challengers; training for election challengers; require, and require the secretary of state to establish election challenger training curriculum. Amends secs. 31 & 730 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.31 & 168.730); adds sec. 730a & repeals sec. 731 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.731).
most_recent_action: Referred To Committee Of The Whole With Substitute (s-2)
summary:
• Requires the Secretary of State to create a comprehensive training curriculum for political parties seeking to designate election challengers.
  • Removes incorporated organizations and organized committees of citizens as groups who may designate a challenger.
  • Requires those seeking to be appointed election challengers to have completed the challenger training within three days to three years before the election.
  • Outlines verification procedures and timelines for those attending the training.

name: Criminal procedure: sentencing guidelines; sentencing guidelines for certain Michigan election law violations dealing with challengers; repeal. Amends sec. 11d, ch. XVII of 1927 PA 175 (MCL 777.11d). TIE BAR WITH: SB 0292'21
most_recent_action: Senate Elections (14:00 1/19/2022 Room 1300, Binsfeld Office Building)
summary: • Eliminates filing certain false statements from the list of election code felonies.

name: Elections: voting procedures; ranked choice voting by cities; provide for. Amends secs. 736b, 736c, 736d, 736e, 736f, 764 & 795 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.736b et seq.) & adds sec. 736h. TIE BAR WITH: HB 5645'21, HB 5646'21
summary:
• Creates exceptions for instructions related to the ballot secrecy sleeve for ranked choice voting.
  • Requires the city clerk to issue ballot marking instructions for elections involving ranked choice voting, and requires that these instructions be used in local elections with specific related requirements.
  • Requires ballot marking instructions to be included for absent voters, including instructions for ranked choice voting, where relevant.
  • Makes exceptions for ranked choice voting tabulation in electronic tabulation requirements.
  • Makes conforming changes.

name: Elections: voting procedures; ranked choice voting by cities; provide for. Amends secs. 321, 576a & 580 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.321 et seq.) & adds sec. 640. TIE BAR WITH: HB 5644'21, HB 5645'21
summary:
• Establishes that candidates considered to have received votes are those candidates where the oval or box next to their names is completely darkened.
  • Removes the requirement that the oval or box be to the left of the name.
  • Requires ranked choice voting ballots allow a voter to rank candidates for each office, with certain stipulations and procedures.
  • Outlines the counting process for ranked choice voting.
  • Outlines what to do in case of a tie, what to do if a voter skips a rank, or uses the same rank twice. 
  • Requires a municipality to conduct a voter education campaign for ranked choice voting.
  • Establishes that a city is responsible for costs associated with the certification and testing of the voting system used for ranked choice voting and outlines tallying requirements for equipment.
  • Makes conforming changes.

name: Elections: filing fees; candidate filing fee in lieu of nominating petitions for the office of county commissioner; make nonrefundable. Amends secs. 11 & 11a of 1966 PA 261 (MCL 46.411 & 46.411a).
summary:
• Requires a candidate for county commissioner to be a resident and registered voter of the district and remain so.

  • Clarifies that county commission elections are partisan and clarifies nomination and qualification procedures.

  • Requires a nonrefundable filing fee be paid and the funds be deposited in the county general fund for specific purposes.

name: Elections: offenses; penalties for assaulting an election official; provide for. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 931c.
most_recent_action: Referred to Committee on Judiciary and Public Safety
summary:
• Establishes that threatening to physically harm an election official is a misdemeanor with possible prison time and fines.
  • Establishes that assaulting an election official and causing injury is a felony with possible prison time and fines.
  • Establishes that assaulting an election official and causes serious injury is a felony with possible prison time and fines.
  • Defines relevant terms.

name: Criminal procedure: sentencing guidelines; sentencing guidelines for certain Michigan election law violations involving assaulting an election official; provide for. Amends sec. 11d, ch. XVII of 1927 PA 175 (MCL 777.11d). TIE BAR WITH: SB 0793'21
most_recent_action: Referred to Committee on Judiciary and Public Safety
summary:
• Adds assault and battery of an election official to the Code of Criminal Procedure.
  • Adds assault and battery of an election official causing serious impairment to the Code of Criminal Procedure.

name: Elections: registration; preregistration to vote at age 16; provide for. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 496a.
summary:
• Allows those ages 16-17 years of age to preregister to vote.
  • Outlines requirements for preregistering.
  • Requires the Secretary of State to create a preregistration application and lists what must be included.
  • Establishes that an individual who preregisters becomes registered at 17 1/2 years old, and may vote after turning 18.
  • Outlines preregistration procedures for the Secretary of State, or other voter registration agency.
  • Prohibits preregistered voters from being included in the precinct voter list for an election.
  • Outlines change of address procedures, notification procedures for when the person becomes 17 1/2 years old, and procedures for when the person turns 18.

name: Elections: election officials; requirement to provide absent voter ballot drop box; provide for. Amends sec. 761d of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.761d) & adds sec. 761e.
summary:
• Requires each absent voter drop box to be checked an emptied daily.
  • Requires each municipality to provide at least one secure absent voter ballot drop box for every 20,000 registered voters in an accessible outdoor location.
  • Establishes that the state will reimburse each municipality for the cost of providing absent voter ballot drop boxes.
  • Outlines the reimbursement approval process, source of funding, submission requirements, and what to do in case the request is not approved.

name: Elections: offenses; provision related to the employ of transportation assistance to the polls; eliminate. Amends sec. 931 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.931).
summary: • Eliminates the provision that prohibits anyone from hiring transportation for conveying voters to an election.

name: Elections: absent voters; electronic return of absent voter ballots by military voters and their spouses; provide for. Amends sec. 759a of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.759a).
summary:
• Establishes that a qualified overseas or military voter may return a ballot electronically.
  • Requires the Secretary of State to create rules, with certain stipulations, regarding electronic return of an absentee ballot for overseas and military voters, including a secure web portal.
  • Defines relevant terms.
  • Lists all qualified uniformed services.

name: Elections: absent voters; tabulating certain absent voter ballots received up to 72 hours after the close of the polls on election day; authorize. Amends secs. 759a, 764a & 765 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.759a et seq.).
categories: Absentee/mail-in ballot return processes,Counting and canvassing procedures
summary:
• Requires jurisdictions to count absent voter ballots postmarked by election day and received within 72 hours of the close of polls.

  • Requires the clerk to transmit the results of absent voter ballots counted after the election by the fourth day after the election.
  • Outlines handling and recording requirements for the clerk for absent voter ballots received more than 72 hours after the close of polls.
  • Redefines "uniformed services."
  • Makes clarifying changes.
  • Makes conforming changes.

name: Elections: absent voters; absent voter counting boards to tabulate absent voter ballots 7 days before an election; authorize. Amends secs. 765, 765a & 765b of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.765 et seq.).
categories: Absentee/mail-in ballot return processes,Counting and canvassing procedures
summary:
• Requires the clerk to deliver absent voter ballot return envelopes to approved absent voter counting boards each day the board meets before election day.
  • Allows the counting boards to be meet up to seven days before the election, 8am-5pm, and requires the municipality to provide notification at least five days before they meet, including certain information.
  • Makes complying changes.
  • Allows absent voter counting boards to meet starting at 7am on election day.
  • Prohibits absent voter counting boards from tabulating vote counts before election day, and specifies what the board may do, and how to secure ballots, before election day.
  • Prohibits an absentee voter from spoiling his or her absentee ballot after the date the absent voter counting board begins meeting and processing ballots.

name: Elections: absent voters; prepaid postage on absent voter ballot application return envelopes and absent voter ballot return envelopes; require, and require the state to reimburse cities and townships for prepaid postage. Amends secs. 761 & 764a of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.761 & 168.764a) & adds secs. 759e & 764e.
summary:
• Requires each clerk to send each voter an absent ballot application, and supporting documents, with certain guidelines. 
  • Requires the clerk to provide a postage paid envelope for absent voting and absent voting applications.
  • Establishes reimbursement procedures for the postage paid envelopes, including qualification guidelines and notification requirements.

name: Elections: other; state to reimburse local government costs for election mail postage; require under certain circumstances. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 39.
summary:
• Requires the state to reimburse each jurisdiction for the cost of election mail postage.

  • Outlines eligibility requirements for the reimbursement.

  • Appropriates general funds for the reimbursement.

  • Outlines a timeline and procedures for accepting, denying, and/or paying the reimbursement.

  • Defines "election mail."

name: Elections: voting procedures; provisional ballot process; modify, require providing identification to obtain an absent voter ballot, prohibit the sending of unsolicited absent voter ballot applications to electors, and require elections to be funded with public money. Amends secs. 495, 523, 759, 759a, 759b, 761, 764b, 813 & 829 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.495 et seq.) & adds secs. 760a & 946.
categories: Ballot access for candidates,Recalls,Vacancy procedures,Election officials
summary:
• Lists required information and items for a voter registration application.
  • Requires the election official to first ask a potential voter for their full name and address and for the individual to sign an affirmation, with certain required elements, before being provided a ballot.
  • Requires an election official to compare signatures for each potential voter, if the technology is available, or ensure the voter's name appears on the voter registration list, and provides instructions on what to do in specific circumstances.
  • Requires the election official to ask for identification of a potential voter, and requires that if the individual does not have identification, the be issued a provisional ballot.
  • Outlines administrative procedures required for when an individual is given a ballot, and what should be done with these records after the polls close. 
  • Furnishes guidelines for applying for an absentee ballot, including timetables, mailings, and deadlines.
  • Provides that an individual may submit a voter registration application and absent voter application at the same time and outlines when and where that voter may complete the absent ballot.
  • Lists ways an application for an absentee ballot may be made.
  • Lists required information and items for an absent voter application.
  • Outlines required procedures for administering an absent voter application.
  • Lists who may be in possession of an absent voter application.
  • Requires jurisdictions to have absent voter applications available and specifies the contents of the applications.
  • Provides required instructions for the absent voter ballot.
  • Specifies what is allowed in different scenarios related to returning the absentee ballot and penalties for those who do not follow the code.
  • Specifies that the absent voter application is confidential and not subject to Freedom of Information Act requests.
  • Specifies procedures for absent uniformed service voters and absent overseas voters to register and to cast an absent voter ballot, including timelines, deadlines, voting in primaries, approval process, email confidentiality, and eligibility. 
  • Clarifies reporting requirements and timelines for absent uniformed services and overseas voter ballots and applications.
  • Outlines deadlines and procedures for applying for an absent voter ballot in the case of illness or other emergencies, and outlines penalties for false statements.
  • Requires each jurisdiction to have access to the department of state data system to verify absent voter application information.
  • Outlines procedures for signature verification on the absent voter application.
  • Specifies how absent voter applications and ballots must be issued.
  • Specifies written instructions and other items for the envelope of the absentee ballot application.
  • Provides deadlines and administrative procedures for return of absentee voter ballots.
  • Specifies conditions for collecting an absent voter ballot and public notification requirements.
  • Outlines procedures, reporting requirements, counting requirements, and timelines for provisional ballots received before the election.
  • Specifies voter registration reporting requirements.
  • Specifies funding sources for election related activities.
  • Defines relevant terms.

name: Elections: election officials; posting of unofficial precinct election results on a website by a county, city, or township clerk; clarify. Amends sec. 807 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.807).
summary: • Prohibits a clerk from posting on the internet unofficial election results until counting of all ballot returns in the jurisdiction is complete.

name: Elections: absent voters; unauthorized opening, tampering with, relocating, or confiscating an absent voter ballot drop box; prohibit, and prohibit blocking, impeding, or obstructing an elector from using an absent voter ballot drop box. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 932g.
summary:
• Prohibits anyone except authorized individuals from tampering with or moving an absent voter ballot drop box.
  • Prohibits anyone from blocking or impeding a voter attempting to return their ballot to the absent voter drop box.
  • Specifies felony penalties.

name: Elections: voters; incarcerated individuals; allow to vote. Amends sec. 492a of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.492a) & repeals sec. 758b of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.758b).
categories: Voting by felons or incarcerated individuals
summary:
• Provides that anyone in jail or prison who is qualified may register to vote.
  • Eliminates a statement that anyone who is imprisoned after being convicted and sentenced is not eligible to vote.

name: Elections: ballots; record retention period for election ballots; extend, and provide for record retention period for electronic poll book software. Amends secs. 811 & 847 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.811 & 168.847).
summary:
• Changes the timeframe for being able to destroy all election returns and ballots from two years to 22 months.
  • Provides that flash drives and electronic poll book flash drives used in an election must be destroyed 30 days after the election except in specific circumstances.

name: Elections: offenses; intimidating an election inspector or preventing an election inspector from performing his or her duties; prohibit. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 931b.
summary:
• Prohibits anyone from intimidating an election official, or prevent the official from performing his or her duties, punishable as a misdemeanor with possible imprisonment or a fine.

  • Defines relevant terms.

name: Elections: campaign practices; individual circulating a petition; prohibit from being paid for each petition signature collected, and require petition circulators to be paid an hourly wage. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding secs. 483b & 957a.
categories: Ballot access for candidates,Ballot measures (initiative and referendum)
summary: • Prohibits an individual employed to circulate a petition from being paid per signature or for completed signature sheets, requiring instead the person be paid an hourly rate.

name: Elections: petitions; procedure for removal of name and signature from a ballot question or recall petition; create. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding secs. 473a & 960a.
categories: Ballot access for candidates,Ballot measures (initiative and referendum)
summary:
• Allows a voter who signed a ballot question petition to submit a written request to the Secretary of State asking that their name be removed from the petition, before the petition is filed.
  • Requires the Secretary of State to immediately remove the person's name and signature when receiving a proper request and forbids that person's name to be counted in the number of petition signatures.

name: Elections: campaign practices; organizations employing an individual as a petition signature gatherer if that individual has been convicted of an election crime; prohibit. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding secs. 484b & 956b.
categories: Ballot access for candidates,Ballot measures (initiative and referendum)
summary: • Prohibits an organization from employing anyone to obtain signatures for ballot question petitions, or recall petitions, who has been convicted of an election crime.

name: Elections: offenses; organization employing a circulator who misrepresents the contents of a ballot question or recall petition; provide for invalidating signatures. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding secs. 484a & 956a.
summary:
• Forbids someone employed to collect signatures for constitutional amendments ballot petitions or recall petitions from making intentionally false statements designed to impact the decisions of specific individuals and groups who may signs the petition.
  • If the person breaks this law, all signatures will be deemed invalid and not counted.

name: Elections: offenses; local governments accepting money or other consideration from individuals or entities for election related activities or election related equipment; prohibit. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 946.
summary:
• Prohibits any governmental entity from accepting donations for elections or election related purposes.
  • Defines relevant terms.

name: Elections: election officials; master card voter registration file; make optional. Amends sec. 502 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.502).
summary: • Provides that a clerk is not required to keep a master voter registration file, however if the clerk does keep one, requires the file to be maintained and updated.

name: Elections: election officials; election officials accepting grants, gifts, or funding from private individuals or entities for conducting elections; prohibit. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 946.
summary:
• Prohibits an election official from accepting or using donated funds for conducting an election, and requires the official to only accept public funding.

  • Defines "conducting an election" and "election official."

name: Elections: absent voters; election options on absent voter ballot applications; modify and expand. Amends sec. 759 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.759).
summary:
• Applies current absent voter ballot mailing procedures to primaries and special primaries.

  • Allows the clerk to provide an annual absent voter application allowing voters to select any elections held that year.

  • Specifies timelines and procedures for this application.

  • Makes conforming changes.

  • Makes clarifying edits.

name: Elections: other; secretary of state to conduct signature verification training for local clerks; require. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 31b.
summary:
• Requires the Secretary of State to conduct signature verification training for clerks before each even numbered primary election year and other elections as determined by the Secretary of State.

  • Specifies what must be included in the training.

  • Requires the Secretary of State to implement these requirements.

name: Elections: audits; state election audit board; create, and require election audit of 2020 general November election. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 646e.
summary:
• Creates a state election audit board and specifies who should be in the seven-person membership.
  • Requires appointments to the board to be made within 28 days of the effective date of the act.
  • Requires the board to contract an independent third party entity to conduct an audit of the November 2020 elections within 40 days of the effective date of this act.
  • Requires the audit board to contract with an independent third party entity to conduct an audit of the voter file, with specific listed tasks, within 45 days of the effective date of this act.
  • Requires the third party entity to conduct an audit of certain items in at least 10% of election precincts in each county (20% for counties larger than 500,000) from the November 2020 elections, with specific instructions on what is to be audited.
  • Outlines requirements for how the third party entity should conduct the audit, and what specific items they need to look into.
  • Excludes individuals cooperating with the audit from criminal penalties.   
  • Outlines reporting requirements for the third party entity regarding the audit, as well as where the report is to be submitted.
  • Dissolves the state election audit board 30 days after it issues its final report.
  • Appropriates funds for the audit activities.
  • Defines relevant terms.

name: Elections: absent voters; identification for election purposes to obtain an absent voter ballot; require, and require a provisional ballot be issued to absent voters without identification for election purpose. Amends secs. 759, 759a, 759b & 761 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.759 et seq.).
most_recent_action: Referred To Committee On Elections And Ethics
categories: Voter ID for absentee/mail-in ballots,Provisional ballots
summary:
• Outlines ID requirements for absent voter ballot applications.
  • Lists qualified uniformed services.
  • Lists ID requirements for an emergency absent voter ballot application.
  • Requires each jurisdiction to have access to the current Department of State data system with updated voter information.
  • Removes conflicting legislation.

name: Elections: ballots; security features on election ballots; require. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 689a.
summary: • Requires each ballot used in an election to include specific security features to prevent duplication.

name: Elections: election officials; procedure for appointing election inspectors; modify. Amends secs. 674 & 677 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.674 & 168.677).
summary:
• Gives those qualified individuals on a list submitted by a major political party first priority to be an election inspector.

  • Gives those qualified individuals who individually filed an application to be an election inspector second priority.
  • Provides that the board of election commissioners will appoint election inspectors from the pool of eligible individuals by random selection.
  • Prohibits the board of election commissioners from appointing more than two election inspectors from the same major political party for every one inspector from the other major political party in a precinct.
  • Requires a board of election commissioners who are unable to appoint an equal number of election inspectors from each major political party to submit a report containing certain information to the Secretary of State within ten days after the election.
  • Requires each clerk to post a notice 40-90 days before an election about the application process to be a precinct election inspector, and includes detailed information about the notice, the application process, and its administration.
  • Makes clarifying changes.

name: Elections: recounts; revisions to recount process; provide for, and provide for informational recounts. Amends secs. 862, 867, 871, 874 & 881 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.862 et seq.).
summary:
• Provides for a county chairperson of a major political party to petition for a recount on behalf of one candidate in one precinct in the county and specifies requirements for submitting the request.

  • Establishes that a refund of a deposit will be issued to a petitioner if it is an informational recount and not done to change the result of the election.

  • Removes references to a precinct that is "not recountable."

  • Removes reasons a precinct may not have a recount.

  • Provides procedures for specific situations where a recount indicates discrepancies that could lead to changing election results.

  • Provides that in an informational recount the board of canvassers will accept all previous returns and describes procedures for recording results of an informational recount.

  • Eliminates procedures for if the number of ballots issued and the numbers shown on the poll list do not match.

  • Makes clarifying edits.

name: Elections: absent voters; public access to absent voter counting boards; clarify and expand. Amends secs. 765a & 766 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.765a & 168.766) & adds secs. 801a & 801b.
summary:
• Authorizes certain individuals to use cameras or video cameras at an absent voter counting board proceeding.
  • Requires a clerk to post public notice at least 14 days before an election about where and when the absent voter counting board will meet to verify signatures.
  • Requires the signature verification process be open at all times to election challengers and poll watchers.
  • Authorizes the use of camera or video camera at the absent voter counting board only when votes are being tabulated, and specifies what may not be recorded, as well as penalties.
  • Provides that officials may provide live video coverage of the custody of all ballots in the tabulation room of certain elections, specifying requirements, timelines, procedures,  publication, what to do in case of video disruption, and storage of the footage.

  • Makes conforming changes.

name: Elections: voters; definition of identification for election purposes; expand to include current concealed pistol license. Amends sec. 2 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.2).
summary: • Allows a current concealed pistol license to be an identification for election purposes.

name: Elections: voting procedures; early voting; provide for. Amends secs. 720 & 735 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.720 & 116.735) & adds sec. 720a.
summary:
• Establishes poll opening and closing times and days for early voting.
  • Establishes notification requirements for early voting.
  • Requires each city and township to provide early voting in at least one polling place and requires the Secretary of State to work with the locale to provide technical assistance.
  • Provides that certain election day provisions also apply to early voting and provides a list of the provisions.
  • Requires early voting ballots to be processed the same way as ballots cast on election day.
  • Codifies that it is a felony to tamper with a ballot container containing ballots voted on the second Saturday before election day.
  • Codifies that it is a felony to disclose election results before the close of polls on election day.
  • Requires the poll book be divided by date and that seperate records be maintained for early voting on the second Satruday before election day.

name: Elections: precinct delegates; deadline for a precinct delegate to file as a write-in candidate; modify. Amends sec. 737a of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.737a).
summary:
• Eliminates a provision about counting write-in votes for precinct delegates who have filed a declaration of intent.
  • Provides clarifying changes.

name: Criminal procedure: sentencing guidelines; sentencing guidelines for certain early voting violations under the Michigan election law; provide for. Amends sec. 11d, ch. XVII of 1927 PA 175 (MCL 777.11d). TIE BAR WITH: SB 0300'21
summary: • Adds the following enumerated election code felonies: tampering with a ballot container in early voting, and disclosing an election result or characterizing how a ballot was voted before the polls close on election day.

name: Elections: initiative and referendum; time frame to review initiative petitions; clarify. Amends sec. 477 of 1954 PA 116 (CL 168.477).
categories: Administrative deadlines,Ballot measures (initiative and referendum),Ballot access deadlines
summary:
• Requires the Bureau of Elections to review initiative petition signatures and the Board of Canvassers to complete the canvas within 90 days of the petition filing.
  • Creates a different timeline for if a petition is filed 45 days or fewer before a November general election.

name: Elections: candidates; nominating petition filing deadline for certain candidates for August 2022 primary election; modify. Amends secs. 53, 133, 163, 551 & 552 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.53 et seq.).
categories: Ballot access for candidates,Ballot access deadlines
summary:
• Sets up the number of signatures required and deadlines for nominating petitions for the offices of Governor, US Representative, and state Senator in the November 2022 election cycle.
  • Allows the Secretary of State and clerks to accept nominating petitions and filing fees by a specified deadline for the November 2022 general election.
  • Furnishes a deadline for complaints about signatures on a petition for the November 2022 general election.
  • Allows the county clerk or the board of state canvassers, in 2022, to make public its staff report about the disposition of challenges filed against a petition at least three days before a decision is made.
  • Furnishes a deadline for complaints about signatures on a nominating petition in the November 2022 general elections.

name: Counties: boards and commissions; deadline for filing nomination petitions or filing fees for county commissioners; modify. Amends sec. 11 of 1966 PA 261 (MCL 46.411).
categories: Ballot access for candidates,Ballot access deadlines
summary:
• Specifies that the deadline for filing nominating petitions or fees for county commissioner is the same as for state representative.
  • Specifies deadlines for filing nominating petitions and fees for the November 2022 general election.

name: Elections: absent voters; pre-processing of absent voter ballots; allow. Amends secs. 24k & 765 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.24k & 168.765).
categories: Absentee/mail-in ballot administration,Counting and canvassing procedures
summary:
• Establishes timelines for examination of absent voter ballot secrecy envelope containers for August primary elections.
  • Makes conforming changes.
  • Extends the requirement that the Secretary of State provide a written report to the House and Senate committees dealing with elections to include a March 1 deadline every two years.

name: Elections: absent voters; prohibition for secretary of state from sending or providing absent voter ballot applications to electors; provide for. Amends sec. 759 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.759).
categories: Absentee/mail-in ballot administration,Election officials,Absentee/mail-in voter assistance
summary:
• Prohibits the Secretary of State from providing an absent voter ballot application (or website link to the application) to an elector who did not request it.
  • Makes conforming changes.

name: Criminal procedure: sentencing guidelines; sentencing guidelines for certain Michigan election law violations dealing with challengers; repeal. Amends sec. 11d, ch. XVII of 1927 PA 175 (MCL 777.11d). TIE BAR WITH: SB 0290'21
summary: • Removes "Filing Certain False Statements" from the list of felonies enumerated in Michigan Election Law.

name: Elections: challengers; certain requirements for election challengers; provide for, and limit the entities that can designate election challengers. Amends sec. 730 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.730) & repeals sec. 731 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.731).
summary:
• Authorizes political parties with a candidate on the ballot to appoint challengers.
  • Removes incorporated organizations and organized committees of citizens from authorization to appoint challengers.
  • Provides that any challenger serving in a precinct must wear an identifying badge with specific information.
  • Provides clarifying edits.

name: Elections: absent voters; permanent absent voter list; require. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 759e.
summary:
• Requires each city or township clerk to maintain a permanent absent voter list.
  • Requires election officials to mail a notification to each registered voter that they may request to be added to the permanent absent voter list, and requires the option to be added to voter registration applications, including information on what must be included.
  • Clarifies information for carrying out the above requirements.
  • Allows voters to request to be removed from the permanent absent voter list, and includes information on how to administer this, including if a voter changes address.

name: Elections: registration; preregistration to vote at age 16; provide for. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 496a.
summary:
• Outlines requirements and procedures for allowing individuals 16-17.5 years of age to preregister to vote.
  • Outlines what is required of the voter to preregister.
  • Outlines procedures for authorities processing the registration, including what to do when the person turns 17.5 years old.

name: Elections: canvassing; board of county canvassers approving assistants employed for canvassing; require, and require at least one member of the board of county canvassers from each major political party be present when canvassing the returns of votes. Amends sec. 24e of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.24e).
summary:
• Clarifies that the board of county canvassers will meet to canvas votes.
  • Requires at least one member from each political party to be present during the entire canvas.
  • Requires the board of county canvassers, and one member from each represented political party, to approve the hiring of each assistant to the clerk before their hiring.

name: Elections: audits; election inspectors for an election audit; require, allow political party observers at an election audit, and require the secretary of state to live video stream an election audit. Amends sec. 31a of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.31a).
summary:
• Requires two qualified inspectors, one from each major political party, to be appointed in each jurisdiction at least five days before an election audit.

  • Requires each political party to designate two observers to monitor the proceedings on an election audit at each precinct where the audit will occur.

  • Requires the Secretary of State to provide live video streaming of the election audit in each precinct on the Secretary of State's website.

name: Elections: other; election inspectors, election challengers, and poll watchers photographing and videotaping the tabulating of votes; authorize. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 801a.
summary:
• Allows an election challenger or poll watcher to video tape with an electronic device when votes are being tabulated at a precinct.
  • Lists actions the election challenger or poll watcher may not videotape at the precinct.
  • Forbids anyone from threatening or impeding an election inspector, challenger, or poll watcher while he or she is conducting authorized videotaping.
  • Outlines penalties.

name: Elections: absent voters; deadline to submit absent voter ballots to an absent voter ballot drop box; provide for. Amends secs. 761d & 764a of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.761d & 168.764a).
summary:
• Prohibits voters from using an absent voter ballot drop box starting after 5pm the day before election day.
  • Requires that each drop box automatically lock at 5pm the day before election day.
  • Makes conforming changes.

name: Elections: ballot proposals; providing the full text of a ballot proposal to a voter or absent voter; require. Amends 1954 Pa 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding secs. 736h & 763a.
summary: • Requires the full text of a ballot proposal to appear on all impacted ballots.

name: Elections: challengers; rights of poll challengers and poll watchers; provide for. Amends sec. 733 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.733) & adds sec. 734a.
summary:
• Establishes that each challenger has the right to stand or sit behind the processing table at the polling place while people are applying to vote and the processing table while counting ballots, but not hinder electors.
  • Establishes that a challenger may observe the election process at a reasonable distance from the election inspectors, and defines "reasonable distance."
  • Establishes that a challenger may challenge the manner in which the duties of election inspectors are performed.
  • Defines "good reason to believe."
  • Allows challengers to get vote results in the precinct after polls close.
  • Allows challengers to use an electronic device in a polling place or counting board, as long as it does not hinder an elector's right to vote a secret ballot.
  • Allows challenger expelled from a polling place to ask for and be provided with a written explanation, and allows the entity appointing the challenger to appoint a new one.
  • Outlines procedures actions for if someone infringes on the rights of a challenger.
  • Defines poll watcher.
  • Outlines what a poll watcher may do at the polls and during a canvas.

name: Elections: other; publication of the name or likeness of the secretary of state, a county clerk, or a local clerk on a communication related to certain election activities; prohibit. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 931b.
summary:
• Prohibits a candidates name or likeness appearing on any communication paid for with public money related to elections.
  • Establishes misdemeanor sanctions for violations.
  • Defines relevant terms.

name: Elections: election officials; secretary of state to obtain information from recognized multistate programs to update voter registration records and submit reports; require. Amends sec. 509o of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.509o).
summary:
• Requires the Secretary of State to request information from each multi-state program or service to verify current residence and voter registration of voters by March 1 each year and outlines timelines for updating procedures for a minimum of 95% of participants.
  • Outlines guidelines and a timeline for reporting this information to the relevant House and Senate committees.
  • Requires the Secretary of State to request information from each multi-state program or service to update data identifying voters who cast improper votes in the preceding November election and to commence related investigations.
  • Outlines related public reporting requirements and deadlines for the Secretary of State to post on the website.

name: Elections: election officials; receipt of private money to be used for election related activities and election related equipment; prohibit, and require the secretary of state to report to the legislature on contracts for election related activities. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding secs. 31b & 946.
summary:
• Directs the Secretary of State to provide a report to the state legislature yearly about contracts entered into related to voting.
  • Prohibits any governmental entity from accepting donations for elections or election related purposes.
  • Defines relevant terms.

name: Elections: election officials; deadline for certificate of determination by board of county canvassers; extend. Amends secs. 201, 581, 822 & 842 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.201 et seq.).
summary:
• Provides clarifying edits.
  • Changes the timeframe for the board of county canvassers to deliver a certificate of returns from 14 days to 21 days after the election to the county clerk.
  • Changes the timeframe for each county clerk to deliver to the Secretary of State a certified statement of how many votes each candidate received from 14 days to 21 days after the election.
  • Changes the timeframe for the Secretary of State to call a meeting of the board of state canvassers from 20 days after the election to 22 days.
  • Changes the timeframe for the board of county canvassers to complete a canvass and certify election results from 14 days to 21 days after an election.
  • Changes the deadline for the board of state canvassers to meet with the Secretary of State for determining the results of an election from 20 days to 22 days after the election.
  • Changes the deadline by which the Secretary of State may ask for certification of returns for electors for President and Vice President, during an expedited canvass, from 14 days after the election to 21 days after the election.
  • Changes the deadline for the Secretary of State to require the receipt of returns after an expedited canvass from 20 days to 22 days after an election.

name: Elections: election officials; deadline for reporting of election results; extend. Amends sec. 809 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.809).
summary:
• Establishes a deadline for submitting sealed election returns and tally sheets to the city clerk and establishes a deadline for the city clerk to transmit the information to appropriate authorities.
  • Changes the deadline for the local clerk to deliver returns from 11am to noon on the day following the election.

name: Elections: canvassing; number of members on a board of county canvassers based on population; provide for. Amends secs. 24a, 24c, 24e & 307 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.24a et seq.).
summary:
• Requires that starting January 1, 2022 existing boards of county canvassers in certain counties will be abolished and replaced, with varying membership depending on county size.
  • Requires one member from each political party represented on the board of county canvassers to be appointed for a two year term.
  • Outlines membership terms and notification requirements for appointments to the board of county canvassers.
  • Prohibits more than 50% of members from one political party on a board of canvassers.
  • Establishes quorum for each county board of canvassers.

name: Elections: qualified voter file; access to the qualified voter file; clarify. Amends sec. 509r of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.509r).
summary: • Provides that only the Secretary of State, a designated voter registration agency, or a municipal clerk will have access to the qualified voter file.

name: Elections: audits; use of video recording devices to record election audit proceedings; authorize, and allow live video coverage of the tabulation of ballots. Amends secs. 31a & 765a of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.31a & 168.765a) & adds sec. 801b.
summary:
• Allows members of each political party to attend and observe an election audit and to record the proceedings with video recording devices.
  • Outlines additional rules prohibiting interference or disruption of the audit.
  • Provides that beginning at 8:00pm on election day, the tabulation of absent voter ballots is subject to the same rules as other tabulation of ballots.
  • Provides that a clerk may provide live, recorded video coverage of the custody of ballots in the tabulation room for certain elections.
  • Requires the recording be available for 40 days on the website and outlines further requirements for the recorded video.

name: Elections: election officials; prepaid postage on absent voter ballot return envelopes; prohibit. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 763.
summary: • Prohibits cities or townships from providing prepaid postage on absent voter ballot return envelopes and prohibits the Secretary of State from providing funding for the prepaid postage.

name: Elections: election officials; report regarding the appointment of an equal number of election inspectors from each major political party in each precinct; require under certain circumstances. Amends sec. 674 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.674).
summary:
• Prohibits the board of election commissioners from appointing more than two election inspectors from a major political party for every one inspector appointed from the other major political party for any precinct.
  • Requires that a city or township submit a report within ten days after an election if they are not able to appoint an equal number of election inspectors from each major political party in each precinct.

name: Elections: election officials; election inspectors to conduct regular balancing checks on precinct tabulators during election day; require. Amends sec. 33 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.33).
summary: • Requires that training of precinct inspectors include training on conducting regular balancing checks to confirm the total number of ballots issued matches the total number of ballots counted.

name: Elections: absent voters; pre-processing of absent voter ballots; authorize. Amends secs. 24k & 765 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.24k & 168.765).
categories: Absentee/mail-in ballot return processes,Counting and canvassing procedures
summary:
• Establishes timelines for examination of absent voter ballot secrecy envelope containers for August primary elections or November general elections.
  • Makes conforming changes.
  • Extends the requirement that the Secretary of State provide a written report to the House and Senate committees dealing with elections to include a March 1 deadline every two years.

name: Elections: election officials; prohibition against an elected or appointed official's name and certain contact information on ballot-related materials; modify. Amends sec. 931a of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.931a).
summary:
• Prohibits contact information for an elected or appointed official from appearing on ballot related materials provided to a voter.
  • Defines ballot related material.

name: Elections: polling places; an elector taking a photograph of himself or herself in a polling place or taking a photograph of his or her election ballot in a polling booth or election compartment; allow, and allow an absent voter to take a photograph of his or her election ballot. Amends secs. 579 & 738 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.579 & 168.738) & adds secs. 736h & 763.
categories: Absentee/mail-in ballot administration,In-person voting and polling places
summary:
• Prohibits a voter from exposing their ballot or absent voter ballot revealing who they voted for in a primary, and outlining procedures if this occurs.
  • Allows voters to display a photograph of their voted ballot more than 100 feet from a polling station.
  • Allows voters to use electronic devices in a voting booth.

name: Elections: other; precinct size; increase, allow precinct consolidation at certain elections, and require clerks to maintain a permanent absent voter list. Amends secs. 658, 659 & 661 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.658 et seq.) & adds sec. 759e.
categories: Permanent lists,In-person voting and polling places

name: Elections: absent voters; absent voting counting boards in cities and townships with more than 1 election precinct; require. Amends sec. 765a of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.765a).
summary:
• Outlines the number of absent voter counting boards required based on the number of election precincts in a district. 
  • Establishes that in a city or township with fewer than 6,000 registered voters and two precincts, an absent voter counting board is not required for both precincts.

name: Elections: offenses; circulator misrepresenting the contents of a ballot question or recall petition; prohibit, and establish penalties. Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding secs. 484a & 956a.
summary:
• Prohibits anyone circulating a certain type of ballot question petition, or a recall petition, from making false statement or misrepresenting aspects of the petition to a certain listed group of individuals or with the purpose of obtaining or influencing their signature decision.

  •  Provides that a violation is subject to a civil fine and a misdemeanor offense.

name: Elections: absent voters; permanent absent voter list; require Amends 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.1 - 168.992) by adding sec. 759e.
summary:
• Requires each clerk to maintain a permanent absent voter list.

  • Allows each clerk to mail a notice to each registered voter indicating a qualified voter may request to be placed in the permanent absent voter list.

  • Requires each voter registration application to include a space for a voter to indicate they wish to be placed on the permanent absent voter list.

  • Describes ways a voter must be able to indicate they want to be added to the permanent absent voter list.

  • Outlines procedures for election staff related to adding voters to the permanent absent voter list.

  • Outlines procedures for a voter to request to be removed from the permanent absent voter list.

  • Outlines reasons a clerk may remove a voter from the permanent absent voter list.

  • Outlines procedures for a change of address for a voter on the permanent absent voter list.

name: Elections: candidates; appointment of individual as candidate to fill a vacant office on the ballot; prohibit if the individual is a candidate for any other office on the same ballot. Amends secs. 326, 352 & 381 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.326 et seq.) & adds sec. 326a.
summary:
• Prohibits a candidate from running for more than one office when the person is temporarily filling a vacancy and running for that office.
  • Outlines rules in the case of the death of a candidate for city office or village office.

name: Education: board members; popular election of intermediate school board members; require. Amends sec. 611, 612, 614, 616, 617 & 703 of 1976 PA 451 (MCL 380.611 et seq.) & repeals sec. 615 of 1976 PA 451 (MCL 380.615).
summary:
• Directs that an intermediate school district us under the supervision of an intermediate school board, consisting of seven elected members, beginning January 1, 2023.
  • Sets further deadlines for implementation.
  • Requires that the first elected intermediate school board member be elected at the 2022 general November election, and take office January 1, 2023.
  • Prohibits appointment to an intermediate school board beginning November 2022, and outlines certain guidelines.
  • Makes conforming changes.
  • Makes clarifying changes.

name: Elections: recounts; provisions regarding election precincts that cannot be recounted; remove. Amends secs. 867, 871, 874 & 881 of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.867 et seq.).
summary:
• Removes reasons for an exemption in recounting ballots.
  • Removes procedures for if ballot counts do not match.
  • Removes reference to precincts considered "not recountable."

name: Elections: absent voters; electronic return of absent voter ballots by military voters and their spouses; provide for. Amends sec. 759a of 1954 PA 116 (MCL 168.759a). TIE BAR WITH: SB 0008'21
categories: Absentee/mail-in ballot return processes,Military/UOCAVA voting,Digital/electronic voting
summary:
• Allows an eligible uniformed or overseas voter to electronically return an absent ballot to the appropriate clerk to be counted using the procedures outlines by the Secretary of State.
  • Requires the Secretary of State to develop policies and procedures for electronic return of ballots and includes a list of what must be included in the policies and procedures.
  • Establishes that the Secretary of State may develop a secure web portal to facilitate electronic return.
  • Defines "eligible member" and "uniformed services."

name: Voter registration provisions modified; absentee voting provisions modified; voting instructions and sample ballot required to be multilingual and interpreters required to be provided; intimidation, deceptive practices, and interference with registration and voting regulated; campaign finance provisions modified; express advocacy definition expanded; penalties provided; reports required; and money appropriated.
categories: Permanent lists,Ballot design,Voting materials,Voting by felons or incarcerated individuals,Voter registration,Automatic voter registration
summary:
As introduced, this bill: 

  • Restores the right to vote for those convicted of a felony after they have served their time and requires the secretary of state to create a publication on this for distribution.
  •  Allows individuals between 16 and 18 years of age to submit a voter registration form for a preregistration process. 
  • Updates voter registration applications to include option for applicant to sign up for permanent absentee voter list. 
  • Prohibits voter registration applicant information from being available to the public before the applicant becomes a registered voter.

summary:

  • Defines "driver's license."

  • Requires the secretary of state to certify the system for automatic voter registration by December 1, 2023.
  • Requires the governor, in consultation with the secretary of state, to determine whether any other state agency must implement automatic voter registration and outlines requirements and deadlines.
  • Requires the secretary of state to compare all application information submitted with other certain existing information to determine whether an individual is registered to vote and outlines procedures when it is determined that someone is ineligible, and procedures for if someone is determined to be eligible.
  • Provides that the county auditor must cancel a voter's record upon written and signed request by the voter.
  • Outlines related voter registration prosecution guidelines for ineligible individuals attempting to register.
  • Provides that eligible applications submitted at least 20 days before an election are authorized to vote at the election.
  • Provides an effective date of July 1, 2023.
  • Directs the secretary of state to develop information about voting rights for people who have been convicted of a crime and directs that it be made available in certain locations and with certain people, with an effective date of June 1, 2024.
  • Requires absentee ballots be mailed at least 46 days before specified elections, with exceptions for special elections.
  • Requires town clerks administering absentee ballots for a general town election held in March to deliver absentee ballots at least 30 days before the election.
  • Directs the secretary of state to keep a list of permanent absentee voters, available to the public.
  • Directs that the names of voters submitting an absentee ballot application must be made public.
  • Requires the ballot board to contact a voter whose envelope was rejected by the method of communication provided on the voter's absentee ballot application.
  • Makes conforming changes.
  • Furnishes that the chief executive officer of each state and local correctional facility will designate an official to provide notice and application of the restoration of the right to vote after release, with specific notification requirements, including provision of the language to be used in notifications, and appropriates $14,000 in 2023 to implement this.
  • Outlines requirements to develop voting instructions and sample ballots in languages other than English, and provides minimum requirements for the three most commonly spoken non English languages in the state.
  • Outlines procedures for designation of language minority districts.
  • Establishes the conditions requiring certain amounts of translated voting materials, and interpreters, and outlines how to hire interpreters, and how interpreters must interact at the polling station.
  • Establishes notification requirements for translated materials.
  • Defines "intimidation," "deceptive practices," "interference with registration or voting."

  • Prohibits anyone from engaging in deceptive election related practices within 60 days of the election.
  • Prohibits anyone from interfering with registration or voting.
  • Provides that a person may be vicariously liable for damages resulting from identified violations.
  • Provides that a person violating outlined rules is guilty of a gross misdemeanor and outlines allowable actions and remedies.
  • Adds to the definition of "expressly advocating" to include that when taken as a whole, it could only be interpreted to be referring to advocating for election or defeat of a specific candidate, with specified guidelines.
  • Prohibits a candidate's principal campaign committee from accepting certain prohibited contributions.
  • Defines "chief executive officer," "foreign influenced corporation," "foreign investor."
  • Lists prohibited actions by a foreign influenced corporation, with an effective date of July 1, 2023.
  • Requires certain corporations making contributions or expenditures to submit certification to the Campaign Finance and Public Disclosure Board, with certain requirements, and an effective date of July 1, 2023.

name: Metropolitan Council member election provided.
categories: Election dates,Administrative deadlines,Ballot access for candidates,Municipal election procedures,Special election procedures,Vacancy procedures,Counting and canvassing procedures,Certification,Recounts,Redistricting
summary:
As introduced, this bill:

  • Establishes a metropolitan council public subsidy program and requires the metropolitan council to provide sufficient funds to pay the public subsidy provided.
  • Directs that a candidate is eligible to receive a public subsidy of $20,000 if the candidate filed a certain spending limit agreement, affidavit of contributions, and their name as it will appear on the ballot.
  • Requires the board to certify to the metropolitan council the maximum number of candidates eligible to receive the subsidy within one week after the filing deadline for the spending limit agreement and affidavit.
  • Requires the metropolitan council to pay the board the amount requested within one week of receiving the certification.
  • Requires the amount to be deposited in the metropolitan council elections account and clarifies that it is appropriated to the board for purposes of the public subsidy program.
  • Specifies that the board will pay the public subsidy to eligible candidates as soon as the board obtains results of the primary election, no later than one week after results are certified.
  • Furnishes that the board must return amounts not paid to candidates, or returned by candidates, to the metropolitan council.
  • Establishes a metropolitan council elections account in the special revenue fund of the state.
  • Makes conforming changes.
  • Limits candidates for subsidy for the metropolitan council election to spending caps on their principal campaign committee of up to $90,000 during an election and $30,000 in a nonelection.
  • Sets contribution limits of $1,000.
  • Specifies that special election subsidies must be equal to those paid in a general election.
  • Outlines standards and guidelines for special elections.
  • Outlines guidelines for filling a vacancy in the office of metropolitan council, including appointing someone, who meets certain conditions, until an election is held.
  • Specifies when a special election should be held and when a candidate should run in a regularly scheduled election.
  • Establishes that the person elected via special election must take office immediately after certification of the election and serve the remainder of the unexpired term, and establishes procedures for what to do if this occurs less than 60 days before the general election.
  • Furnishes that if districts have been redrawn since the beginning of the term of vacant office, the election must be based on the redrawn district.
  • Furnishes that a vacancy may be declared by the metropolitan council if a council member is unable to serve or attend meetings for a 90 day period due to illness, absence, or refusal to attend meetings, in which case the council may appoint someone to fill the vacancy by following certain procedures.
  • Specifies that if the council determines that the member is able to resume duties, the council must record this determination and remove the appointed officeholder and restore the original member.
  • Requires the state canvassing board to complete its canvass of a special election for a metropolitan council member and declare results within four days after the returns of the county canvassing boards are certified, excluding Sundays and holidays.
  • Outlines guidelines for contesting a canvass.
  • Furnishes that a certification of election in a special election for metropolitan council must be issued by the county auditor or secretary of state two days after the canvassing board finishes the canvass, excluding Sundays and holidays, and specifies what to do in case of a contest.
  • Provides that until the completion of redistricting following the 2020 census, the metropolitan council will have 16 members and a chair (from 17 members), and clarifies that after the redistricting, there will be 17 members, each elected from a district in which he or she resides.
  • Clarifies that the term of a council member is four years, except those elected in a year ending in two, whose term is instead two years.
  • Provides that at the general election in the year ending in the number four, members must be elected from the newly drawn districts.
  • Requires council members to select a chair, who will serve for two years.
  • Outlines compensation and reimbursement for council members.

name: Election provision of Metropolitan Council members
Authorization of absentee ballot drop boxes repealed.
